definition: abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Germans became quickly known for their fetish movies.
sentences.chinese: 之后德国的恋物癖电影迅速扬名世界。

sentences.english: I think that Rex will go far and become famous.
sentences.chinese: 我认为雷克斯将会扬名四海。

sentences.english: Maybe this could be something that helps get his name back out there in the basketball circles.
sentences.chinese: 或许此举有助于他重新在这个圈子里扬名立万。

sentences.english: She wants to get about the world.
Beckett was the first of the absurdists to win international fame.
sentences.chinese: 贝克特是第一个扬名国际的荒诞派作家。

sentences.english: This is the opportunity for the club to really establish itself on the European stage.
sentences.chinese: 这也是我们在欧洲舞台上扬名立万的机会。

sentences.english: They can come out and demand a salary of $60, 000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 他们能扬名于世，并可要求6万美元的年薪。

sentences.english: But I'm confident that he has what it takes to make it here.
sentences.chinese: 但我相信他能在这里扬名立万。

sentences.english: One is to make a name for oneself and the other is to keep it.
sentences.chinese: 世界上有两件事情很不一样，扬名立万和保持声誉。

sentences.english: The winners were not only given handsome awards but gained high fame.
sentences.chinese: 比赛的胜出者不仅能得到丰厚的奖励还能扬名四海。

definition: to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
to make a name/to become famous
to make one's name/to become famous
lit. reputation will go down in history (idiom); fig. achievements will earn eternal glory
to win instant success (idiom)/to start off successfully
